forumNotes.author: wtarkan
forumNotes.content:
![b28r.png](http://img14.imageshack.us/img14/7470/b28r.png)

This program allowing you to test your multiboot menu workouts or Disc images fast and easily , For example if you have a bootable image file or bootable Usb image etc.. You can simply load the ISO and make use of QEMU's virtualizing capabilities to emulate a system and check if the loaded file is ready to be written on disc.  

**NOTE:** It is for quickly testing boot-loaders for USB drives or small image files with low resource requirements . It wasn't developed to be a full virtualization environment

**What is new:**

1· Drag and drop error -- Fixed  
2· Minor interface changes  
3· Improvement of codes

[http://www.sordum.or...ur-image-files/](http://www.sordum.org/7763/qemu-simple-boot-v1-2-easily-test-your-image-files/ "External link")

forumNotes.author: chenall
forumNotes.content:
Thanks,Can you add NET boot support?

e.g.

qemu.exe -boot n -net nic -net user,tftp=e:\\boot,bootfile=grldr

forumNotes.author: Brito
forumNotes.content:
Seems like a good tool. I'd just recommend making it available on the downloads portal, around here it will soon disappear among all the forum discussions.

This is the link: <http://reboot.pro/files>

If you need help or have your account changed to permit uploading files there, let me know.

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.author: TheHive
forumNotes.content:
Very good work. I like that it remembers the iso's tested and that you can choose to delete them from the list. Very easy to use gui front end to test bootable iso's in Quemu emulator.

Only thing i see it might need also is a way to create a harddrive.

Thank you.

forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Just for the record, there has been since the dawn of time ![:w00t:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/w00t.gif) a similar tool, MobaLiveCD:  
[http://mobalivecd.mobatek.net/en/](http://mobalivecd.mobatek.net/en/ "External link")  
which is/was however limited to iso images:  
[http://reboot.pro/to...077-mobalivecd/](http://reboot.pro/topic/6077-mobalivecd/ "")  
and a acompanion app MobaliveUSb:  
[http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=22273](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=22273 "External link")  

This new thingy seems to me like an useful little tool, adding some missing choices. :smile:  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko
